title: Yearly Employment Distribution
description: This is a time series analysis of the number  of employed GVSU graduates from 2016 to 2021.
contents:
It was observed that there was a higher number of employed graduates than those who were seeking employment throughout the period of 2016 to 2021. For instance in 2020, employed students were 1232 while those seeking employment were 287. There was a decline in the number of students employed from 2019 to 2020 (1327 to 1232) but there was almost an equal increase in the number of graduates who enrolled for masters degree in the same year (263 to 340). However, 2021 is already showing a rise in the number of students getting jobs.

title: Alumni Distribution
description: The map below shows the number of GVSU alumni as distributed in the different states of USA.
contents: It was observed that most (87%) GVSU graduates remain in Michigan after graduation.

title: Alumni Salary Distribution
description: The chart below shows the salary ranges for GVSU almni.
contents: It was observed that the highest number of graduates earn either below $20,000 or an average of $40,000 annually. We concluded that these results exhibit those who did not utilized their degree versus those who did respectively. However, it is crucial to note that cumulatively, most graduates earn above $20,000 yearly.

title: Career Center Review
description: This is an analysis of the levels of satisfaction for various GVSU career center services.
contents:
The results revealed that GVSU graduates had a general sense of satisfaction with the Career Center services across the board.



It was observed that most GVSU graduates had utilized the career center job and internship search services as well as the handshake job search web application to obtain employment after graduation. However, results showed that only about half of the 4000 respondents leveraged career center workshops and only a little over a half utilized on-campus interview practice offered by the career center.



This revealed the gap that exists in students making time to attend career workshops as well as the under-utilization of interview preparation services offered by the career center.



Therefore, we encourage all students to maximize the use of the career center services to prepare themselves for the job market.
